item.title: Diehard Coders Just Saved All of NASA's Earth Science Data
item.description:
Diehard Coders Just Saved All of NASA's Earth Science Data

On Saturday morning, the white stone buildings on UC Berkeley's campus radiated with unfiltered sunshine. The sky was blue, the campanile was chiming. But instead of enjoying the beautiful day, 200 adults had willingly sardined themselves into a fluorescent-lit room in the bowels of Doe Library to rescue federal climate data.

item.title: Live programming IoT systems with MsgFlo+Flowhub
item.description:
Live programming IoT systems with MsgFlo+Flowhub

Last weekend at FOSDEM I presented in the Internet of Things (IoT) devroom, showing how one can use MsgFlo with Flowhub to visually live-program devices that talk MQTT. Video recording of MsgFlo Internet of Things presentation at FOSDEM 2017.

item.title: Working on an Android tablet, 2017 edition
item.description:
Working on an Android tablet, 2017 edition

Back in 2013 I was working exclusively on an Android tablet. Then with the NoFlo Kickstarter I needed a device with a desktop browser. What followed were brief periods working on a Chromebook, on a 12" MacBook, and even an iPad Pro. But from April 2016 onwards I've been again working with an Android device.

item.title: How travel tech evolved over three decades during my three trips to Russia
item.description:
How travel tech evolved over three decades during my three trips to Russia

From the Kodak DCS 420 to the iPhone 6 (and approximately 6,000 vodka shots): An excerpt from "Bears in the Streets: Three Journeys Across a Changing Russia."

item.title: Integrating Progressive Web Apps deeply into Android
item.description:
Integrating Progressive Web Apps deeply into Android

In 2015, we added a new feature to Chrome for Android that allows developers to prompt users to add their site to the Home screen for fast and convenient access. That feature uses an Android shortcut , which means that web apps don't show up throughout Android in the same way as installed native apps.

item.title: No title
item.description: New website for MsgFlo, the distributed flow-based programming environment for message queues: https://MsgFlo.org

item.title: CSS Grid - Table layout is back. Be there and be square.
item.description:
CSS Grid - Table layout is back. Be there and be square.

CSS Grid is a new layout system for the web.

item.title: How to Build an Autocracy
item.description:
How to Build an Autocracy

The preconditions are present in the U.S. today. Here's the playbook Donald Trump could use to set the country down a path toward illiberalism. It's 2021, and President Donald Trump will shortly be sworn in for his second term. The 45th president has visibly aged over the past four years.

item.title: Vanishing point: the rise of the invisible computer
item.description:
Vanishing point: the rise of the invisible computer

In 1971, Intel, then an obscure firm in what would only later come to be known as Silicon Valley, released a chip called the 4004. It was the world's first commercially available microprocessor, which meant it sported all the electronic circuits necessary for advanced number-crunching in a single, tiny package.
